DOC.brief_summary: Using stable isotope methodology , investigator determine postabsorptive postprandial muscle protein synthetic response 60 female adult ( Age 50-79 , BMI : < 30 kg/m2 ) immediately acute bout resistance exercise . Participants divide 5 group twelve woman ( n=12 ) . Each group receive different protein beverage placebo consume follow resistance exercise training . Group 1 consume beverage consist whey protein ; group 2 consume whey protein supplement additional leucine ; group 3 consume whey protein supplement additional leucine hydrolyze whey peptide ; group 4 consume whey protein supplement additional leucine citrulline ; group 5 consume water . During test , blood muscle sample collect .
DOC.brief_title: Nutritional Strategies Augment Postprandial Muscle Protein Synthetic Response Ingestion Low Dose Protein Middle-aged Women
DOC.criteria: BMI < 30 kg/m2 Healthy , sedentary Tobacco use Allergies milk consumption Unusually high protein consumption Vegan diet Allergies antibiotic xylocaine Phenylketonuria ( PKU ) Diagnosed GI tract diseases Arthritic condition A history neuromuscular problem Heart disease Metabolic disorder Liver , kidney , urinary disease Musculoskeletal problem Autoimmune disease Neurological disease Previous participation amino acid tracer study Predisposition hypertrophic scar keloid formation Individuals medication know affect protein metabolism ( i.e . corticosteroid , nonsteroidal antiinflammatories , prescription strength acne medication ) . Individuals use thyroid medication medication affect endocrine function Pregnancy Contraindications exercise BMI â‰¥30 supplement influence protein metabolism ( e.g omega 3 fish oil )
